Class Hangman

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hangman
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HangmanManager

    public class Hangman
extends Object
implements HangmanManager
    The Hangman class keeps track of the state of a game of hangman. Methods provide access to the current set of guesses, number of wrong guesses remaining, and the current pattern to be displayed to the user. The record method updates state by recording a new guess and updating the other values appropriately.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Brian von Behren
    See Also:
    HangmanManager

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private List<String> candidateDictionary
      List of potential goal words.
      private static boolean CHEAT
      Flag that controls if the computer will cheat by adjusting the goal word as guesses are made.
      private int goalLength
      Length of the goal word.
      private SortedSet<String> goalWords
      Current list of potential goal words.
      private SortedSet<Character> guessedLetters
      Sorted set of all letters guessed by the player.
      private int guessesLeft
      The number of wrong guesses that result in a loss for the player given the current state of the game.
      private int guessLimit
      The number of wrong guesses that results in a player loss.

        Constant Field Values

      • goalWords

        private SortedSet<String> goalWords
        Current list of potential goal words. Size will be 1 unless CHEAT flag is set.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hangman

        private Hangman()
        The default no-parameter constructor is not publicly available.

      • Hangman

        public Hangman(List<String> dictionary,
               int length,
               int wrongGuessLimit)
        Standard constructor for the Hangman game. Initialized state based on parameters.
        Parameters:
        dictionary - the list of potential goal words
        length - the length of the goal word
        wrongGuessLimit - the number of wrong guesses that will result in a loss
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if candidateDictionary is empty
        IllegalArgumentException - if goalLength is less than 1
        IllegalArgumentException - if guessLimit is less than 1
        IllegalArgumentException - if there are no words in the candidateDictionary with size equal to goalLength

    • Method Detail

      • words

        public Set<String> words()
        Access the set of candidate words; if size == 1, contents are the actual goal word.
        Specified by:
        words in interface HangmanManager
        Returns:
        the goal word or the candidate goal words

      • cheatWords

        private Set<String> cheatWords()
        Access the set of candidate words. Contents will be modified as new letters are guessed. If size = 1, then there is only a single word in the candidateDictionary that matches the gussed letters
        Returns:
        the goal word or the candidate goal words

      • wrongGuessLimit

        public int wrongGuessLimit()
        Access the limit on wrong guesses.
        Specified by:
        wrongGuessLimit in interface HangmanManager
        Returns:
        the number of wrong guesses that results in a player loss

      • guessesLeft

        public int guessesLeft()
        Access the number of wrong guesses that result in a loss for the player given the current state of the game.
        Specified by:
        guessesLeft in interface HangmanManager
        Returns:
        the number of wrong guesses that would result in a loss

      • guesses

        public SortedSet<Character> guesses()
        Access the set of letters already guessed by the player.
        Specified by:
        guesses in interface HangmanManager
        Returns:
        the set of letters guessed by the player

      • pattern

        public String pattern()
        Return the hangman-style display pattern of letters and dashes (with interpolated spaces) appropriate to the current state based on the letters already guessed and the goal.
        Specified by:
        pattern in interface HangmanManager
        Returns:
        the hangman-style pattern to be displayed to the user
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no goal word

      • cheatPattern

        private String cheatPattern()
        Return the hangman-style display pattern of letters and dashes (with interpolated spaces) appropriate to the current state based on the letters already guessed and the goal.
        Returns:
        the hangman-style pattern to be displayed to the user
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no possible goal word

      • record

        public int record(char guess)
        Record state changes based on new letter guess.
        Specified by:
        record in interface HangmanManager
        Parameters:
        guess - the letter being guessed [Precondition: guess must be lower-case letter] [Precondition: guess must not be among letters already guessed]
        Returns:
        the number of occurrences of the guessed letter in the goal
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no guesses left or no goal word
        IllegalArgumentException - if letter is already guessed

      • cheatRecord

        private int cheatRecord(char guess)
        Record state changes based on new letter guessed, using the rules for "cheating".
        Parameters:
        guess - the letter being guessed [Precondition: guess must be lower-case letter] [Precondition: guess must not be among letters already guessed]
        Returns:
        the number of occurrences of the guessed letter in the goal
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no guesses left or no goal word
        IllegalArgumentException - if letter is already guessed

      • getFirstGoalWord

        private String getFirstGoalWord()
        Obtains the first word of the set of goal words or an empty string if the set is empty. For the normal rules, the set will always have a single item.
        Returns:
        a single goal word or an empty string.
